content.question: Which of the following conclusions can best be reached based on the sentiments expressed in the excerpt?

choices.label: Sectional tensions erupted because most Southerners did not support Abraham Lincoln.
Sectional divisions were showing signs of diminishing.
The Compromise of 1850 prevented the outbreak of long-term conflict.
The election of 1860 was a success for the idea that territories should vote whether or not to have slavery.

content.answer: Sectional tensions erupted because most Southerners did not support Abraham Lincoln.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
